#summary Installing a raw printer driver on XP using Add New Printer Wizard
#labels Featured,Phase-Deploy,Phase-Support
= Introduction =
Here are step-by-step instructions for setting up raw printing on Windows XP. These steps proved successful in getting the jZebra Applet to print to a raw printer queue from a web page loaded on Windows XP in Firefox and Internet Explorer. _Last tested 11/07/2009, Windows XP SP2_ ([http://fatbuttlarry.blogspot.com/2009/11/raw-printing-from-windows-xp-zebra.html mirror]) 

= Scripting =
* Rather script this?  From a command prompt window try this:

   {{{ 
      rundll32 printui.dll,PrintUIEntry /if /b "Zebra" /f "%WINDIR%\inf\ntprint.inf" /r "lpt1:" /m "Generic / Text Only"
   }}}

* Replace "lpt1:" with your port, such as "COM5:", etc.  USB ports generally need drivers installed first for port to show up.

= Steps =
`Windows XP`

  # Open Control Panel. Click "*Printers and Faxes*"<br>[http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW2L2lQwJI/AAAAAAAAATw/THPg257TKgo/s1600-h/1.png http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW2L2lQwJI/AAAAAAAAATw/THPg257TKgo/s400/1.png]<br><br>
  # Click "*Add Printer*"<br>[http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW2HPoatcI/AAAAAAAAATo/IqHiAh4bj6g/s1600-h/2.PNG http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW2HPoatcI/AAAAAAAAATo/IqHiAh4bj6g/s400/2.PNG]<br><br>
  # Click "*Next*" at the welcome screen.<br>[http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW2HL22vxI/AAAAAAAAATg/gc9Oc-1MOiE/s1600-h/3.PNG http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW2HL22vxI/AAAAAAAAATg/gc9Oc-1MOiE/s400/3.PNG]<br><br>
  # Click "*Local printer attached to this computer*" and deselect "~~*Automatically detect and install...*~~". Click "*Next*".<br>[http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW2G2hBa0I/AAAAAAAAATY/VPSh7MXHW0s/s1600-h/4.PNG http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW2G2hBa0I/AAAAAAAAATY/VPSh7MXHW0s/s400/4.PNG]<br><br>
  # Click "*Create New Port*" and from the drop-down select "*Standard TCP/IP*" port.<br>[http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW2Gnum5xI/AAAAAAAAATQ/wdCkE1JUmW0/s1600-h/5.PNG http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW2Gnum5xI/AAAAAAAAATQ/wdCkE1JUmW0/s400/5.PNG]<br><br>
    * For *COM Ports*, instead of creating a new TCP/IP port, use an existing port and chose your COM port (COM1, COM2, etc)
    * For *Parallel Ports*, instead of creating a new TCP/IP port, use an existing LPT port (LPT1, LPT2, etc).
    * For *USB Ports*, instead of creating a new TCP/IP port, use the available USB port.  This is tricky as the USB port doesn't always list as an available port.  In the past I've had to install the printer drivers first to list the USB port, and then change the driver to Generic/Text afterward.
  # At the Port Wizard Welcome screen click "*Next*"<br>[http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW2GoWylHI/AAAAAAAAATI/h2imLtUSAZk/s1600-h/6.PNG http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW2GoWylHI/AAAAAAAAATI/h2imLtUSAZk/s400/6.PNG]<br><br>
  # For Printer Name or IP Address, put the hostname or IP of your printer and click "*Next*"<br>[http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW10LcSyUI/AAAAAAAAATA/kd0tcqX_FLk/s1600-h/7.PNG http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW10LcSyUI/AAAAAAAAATA/kd0tcqX_FLk/s400/7.PNG]<br><br>
  # If prompted for a Device Type, select "*Generic Network Card*". Click "*Next*".<br>[http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1z9kZCPI/AAAAAAAAAS4/UkRxy6kW3P4/s1600-h/8.PNG http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1z9kZCPI/AAAAAAAAAS4/UkRxy6kW3P4/s400/8.PNG]<br><br>
  # A summary page will display with your port information. Click "*Finish*".<br>[http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1zjA4nBI/AAAAAAAAASw/UTbFFGFmTMM/s1600-h/9.PNG http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1zjA4nBI/AAAAAAAAASw/UTbFFGFmTMM/s400/9.PNG]<br><br>
  # The Printer Wizard will continue. When prompted for Manufacturer, click "*Generic*". For printer, select "*Generic/Text Only*". Click "*Next*".<br>[http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1zc6-UnI/AAAAAAAAASo/cosdqEsoc2k/s1600-h/10.PNG http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1zc6-UnI/AAAAAAAAASo/cosdqEsoc2k/s400/10.PNG]<br><br>
  # If prompted to keep the driver, click "*Keep the existing driver*". Click "*Next*".<br>[http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1zQlZvqI/AAAAAAAAASg/EbADuqx8uz0/s1600-h/11.PNG http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1zQlZvqI/AAAAAAAAASg/EbADuqx8uz0/s400/11.PNG]<br><br>
  # Type the printer name you'd like to use. For example, "*zebra*". It will ask to use this printer as the default printer. Click "*No*". Click "*Next*".<br>[http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1onvAmWI/AAAAAAAAASY/JChPSKKJPT0/s1600-h/12.PNG http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1onvAmWI/AAAAAAAAASY/JChPSKKJPT0/s400/12.PNG]<br><br>
  # When prompted to share the printer, click "*Do not share this printer*". This setting can be changed later if needed.<br>[http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1ocbvBQI/AAAAAAAAASQ/bSneNnnfGyU/s1600-h/13.PNG http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1ocbvBQI/AAAAAAAAASQ/bSneNnnfGyU/s400/13.PNG]<br><br>
  # You will be prompted to print a test page. Click "*No*" and click "*Next*".<br>[http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1oIOGa1I/AAAAAAAAASI/G_PK0LFY984/s1600-h/14.PNG http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1oIOGa1I/AAAAAAAAASI/G_PK0LFY984/s400/14.PNG]<br><br>
  # The wizard summary page will appear. Click "*Finish*"<br>[http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1n-efNzI/AAAAAAAAASA/8zB0EO0Eeto/s1600-h/15.PNG http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1n-efNzI/AAAAAAAAASA/8zB0EO0Eeto/s400/15.PNG]<br><br>
  # Your printer will now list under "*Printers and Faxes*"<br>[http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1n0SgOhI/AAAAAAAAAR4/GRj8UtzVSmA/s1600-h/16.PNG http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_9hmP3Ho0t14/SvW1n0SgOhI/AAAAAAAAAR4/GRj8UtzVSmA/s400/16.PNG]<br><br>
  # Troubleshooting: (If problems exist) Make sure the new port (under the new printer *properties --> ports --> find your new port --> configure port*) is set to "*RAW*" under protocol. If printing to a non-standard port (other than 9100) adjust the port settings correctly.<br><br>
  # End of Steps

-Tres
